name: Whiskey Pete's Hotel & Casino

reviews.text: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The room was visibly dirty. We must have been in an older/overflow room. View of the back mechanical shed, ripped bedding and dirty floors, broken toilet seat. I would NEVER stay here again!!! Not too mention they were rude to my family.
reviews.title: Dingy/Awful
Economical
reviews.text: I usually stay in high priced hotels, my family were on a budget someone suggested WP Prime. i LOVE THIS PLACE!! Smelled good no horrible smells. Very clean. very nice staff Casino was smokey I did not stay in there for long periods of time. I was a jackpot winner on slots...YEAH ME!!!

Sitting on the border, welcoming travelers on Interstate 15 are the Primm Valley Resorts. This oasis is actually 3 separate hotels and casinos that sit on both sides of the Interstate. The properties are connected by a monorail system that runs on the weekends as well as a shuttle bus that runs constantly. So while you may stay at one property, all three are easily accessible. I have stayed at all three properties in the last 30 days and this review is mainly focused on Whiskey Pete's Hotel and Casino.
reviews.title: Affordable, Comfortable and Fun

reviews.text: Whiskey Pete's is the oldest of the three properties and has recently seen some renovations to the rooms. Typically what you get when you stay here is a decent room for a great price, especially if you stay during the week. Just like any destination, if you stay during a peak time, you will pay higher rates. The rooms are in decent shape with new carpets and other upgrades.
reviews.title: surprising service for this cheap hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino is fun and has all the games you would normally find as well as a decent area for table games. The three properties offer a ton of dining choices and different atmospheres. The property is at its busiest on the weekends and you will find all the restaurants and attractions open. During the week, some of them may not be available, but that is reasonable. There is always good food to be had as well as a great time.
reviews.title: Better than most reviews
Oh my...
reviews.text: We were in a rental car, coming back from a visit to the Grand Canyon, and made the mistake of not booking a room for Saturday night of St Patrick's Day weekend. We tried to stay in Laughlin but could not get a room - nothing. So we called the reservations line for the Primm resorts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had never laid eyes on Primm. The lady on the phone quoted us a rate $20 cheaper ($84) for Whiskey Petes than their other properties so I asked her what the difference was in the locations. She said there really wasn't any, except that rooms were filling faster at the other property so Whiskey Petes was cheaper.
reviews.title: We Stopped as a Pit-Stop to see the Bonnie & Clyde Car

reviews.text: Ha! Cheaper, and also on the other side of the highway from the other 2 bigger nicer-looking properties with more amenities and access to shopping and food! We were on the wrong side of the highway and for some unknown reason the monorail crossing the highway shuts at 7:45pm - honestly, that is PM, at casino properties!!. Our only dining options, Ihop or McDonalds. WiFi is $10 for 24 hrs. The machines were the stingiest I've played in Nevada, Check-in took forever, only 2 very sweet but very slow ladies working & they also were trying to answer the phones and deal with guests/security issues.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room must have been nice once upon a time. The shower had 2 seats built into it, I'll bet it was great when it was new. It wasn't filthy, we stayed the night - basically holed up in it, with the monorail closed and the tight slots there was nothing else to do after we dined at Ihop.
reviews.title: Oh my gosh what a dump!

reviews.text: I'm not a big gambler at all, I just like to play small amounts on the slots. I'm quite happy to lose in the end as long as I have been happily entertained with up & down slot play and a free drink for an hour or so without getting totally fleeced (CircusCircus is great for this!). At Whiskey Petes those machines gobbled our money so fast with so little return that we just went to our room & stayed there til we left without breakfast in the morning, laughing about this place! It sure made Vegas look good.
reviews.title: GROSS

reviews.text: One of the best Casino Resorts outside of Vegas. We absolutely loved our stay. The parking was somewhat of an issue but we will definitely be back. The food was appetizing and staff was superb! We thoroughly enjoyed the machines and even won some money.
reviews.title: We had a blast!!

reviews.text: I just got back from a one night stay at Whiskey Petes. I will not stay there again. I have stayed here many times, and this had to be the worst. I had a switch rooms, because the first room was, dirty, moldy, no knobs on dresser, broken toilet, wall paper peeling. It was just bad. The pool was closed and not one person was at the IHOP restaurant..
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: Do not stay here.
reviews.title: Terrible says enough...but I need to say more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well we got in late of course trying to drive to Nevada after work so thinking checking in was going to be a breeze. Nope. check in took forever and then my husband tells me he read reviews about how horrible check in was (ughh). So I'm looking and watching the check in counter and I don't know what it is - maybe the employees were tired because they were very slow- or their check in system was slow but whatever the reason was they sure didn't look at the line and acknowledge us or tell us "we will be with you as soon as possible" or anything. NADA. So right off the back bad customer service. When we were getting attended to or rather being given our keys we had to ask for directions to the room- guess they just assume you look at the number and know where to go- where to park etc. SO we get to our room and beds are made but made our way to bathroom and maybe the maid left on a break while cleaning and forgot to come back because that's exactly what it looked like. Some dirty towels some clean and hung- shower hadn't been cleaned (opened containers of shampoo and soap) so I called housekeeping because what was the point of calling the front desk - they were so slow at checking us in why not go directly to the source and told housekeeping to come and clean the bathroom real quick. And then go to get on the internet and decide to call guest services (figure they could quickly answer the call ) and they said that the wifi was not free. THEN WHY DO ALL THE BILLBOARDS STATE FREE WIFI AT WHISKEY PETES? SO I pay for the wifi so I could play (stream) a movie on my nook to help my son go to sleep and the service was so crappy the movie couldn't stream. And then my husband said the service was very slow even for his email or facebook. SO I have asked the carrier LV.net for a refund and their last email to me was asking - why do I feel I deserve a refund after they show (some amount) of downloading during my 24 hour period- um hello!!!! first off the service (on the billboards stated) was supposed to be free and then I ya I can see how mb were used but the service was not equipped enough to stream (what I paid for). Oh my gosh I almost forgot. I sent my husband down to McDonalds and asked him to get me a hot coffee. The kid with the gauges told him they didn't serve hot coffee. Only Iced. At that point I think my husband just kind of gave up on the hotel and came back empty handed. I am so glad I did not go downstairs and attempt to get a coffee. At that point I think I would have blown up.
reviews.title: I found a treasure in the desert!

reviews.text: We were going to Vegas from California and thought,"Let's go a day early and stay in Primm so we can leisurely stroll into Vegas in the morning." So we made a reservation at Whiskey Pete's. Upon arrival, the staff was quick and helpful and we found our room with no trouble. We decided to go play in the casino. Played a few slots but the blackjack tables looked so inviting. Not all the crazy crowds like the strip and everyone looked like they were actually enjoying themselves. It was a blast! The dealers were great, the cocktail waitresses were friendly and prompt, and the social atmosphere was relaxing yet alive! We had a lot of fun and won a few free hotdogs and had an absolute blast. I plan on stopping here every time I go to Vegas from now on. I see a lot of negative reviews so I'll sum it up. If you are a regular person who likes to have fun you will love this place. If you are a yuppie or a twenty-something guy who wears tap-out shirts (but aren't a pro fighter) and drinks a few beers and thinks he's Superman you will hate it.
reviews.title: This Place Should Be Torn Down - Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at.

reviews.text: Typical casino hotel. It could have been better. My main complaint is that all of the ice machines were out of order. I tried several different floors, and all were not functioning. Finally someone told me I had to go to the bar in the casino to get ice.
reviews.title: Not well maintained

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another complaint - no wireless service. I believe this is an effort to keep you out of your room and into the casino, where they make all of their money.
reviews.title: Spa and slide inop, pool area messy, tram inop

reviews.text: One last complaint - terrible dining choices. There are two places to eat in this hotel, a McDonalds and a IHOP, that's it. If you want other choices you have to get in your car and drive.
reviews.title: HOORAY !! Affordable & Impressive

reviews.text: The only good thing about this place is the price, so I guess I should expect less when I only paid $35 for a night.
reviews.title: Affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, hard to keep guests seeing the quality. Spa and pool slide were both inop. Looks like its been broke for months. Pool area never been swept since winter tree foliage drop of pine needles. Tran service was inop to other Primm properties. Not sure why maintenance isn't keeping up with "eye soars". Not sure why pool closed at 7:45pm when lifeguards leave as other hotels allow guests to use pool without lifeguards? Person handling towel issuance could have worked instead of doing nothing but talking
reviews.title: Lots to do, basic but ok.

description: Featuring a lucky 777 guest rooms, we’re located just outside of Las Vegas on the I-15 freeway. Featuring your favorite slots and table games, Whiskey Pete’s has exactly what you’re looking for.
